summary: PTX3 is a 45-kDa glycoprotein that can form an octameric structure, i.e. a complex quaternary structure with eight protomer subunits held together by both covalent (disulfide) and non-covalent interactions. PTX3 shares with short pentraxins a C-terminal pentraxin-like domain that can bind with ligands, such as complement component C1q, microbial HC-HA complex is a covalent complex formed by high molecular weight HA and HCs via an ester bond by a catalytic action of TSG-6 (16–18) infertility ensues in female ptx3-deficient mice because of the lack of PTX3 that is important to stabilize HC-HA in the COC matrix. from the human amniotic membrane (AM), we have isolated and characterized a HC-HA complex that exerts 3-(N,N-dimethyl palmitylammonio) propanesulfonate (Zwittergent3–16), protease inhibitor mixture (including 4-(2-aminoethyl)-benzenesulfonyl fluoride hydrochloride, aprotinin, bestatin hydrochloride, E-64, leupeptin, and pepstatin A) were obtained from Sigma-Aldrich (St. Louis recombinant human TNF, recombinant human Pentraxin 3/TSG-14, recombinant human TSG-6, and human/mouse TSG-6 mAb (catalog no. MAB2104) were from R&D Systems (Minneapolis, MN) PTX3 mAb (catalog no. MNB4) were from Enzo Life Sciences, Inc. ELISA kits for murine IL-10 and IL-12p40 were from Biolegend. the culture medium was changed every 2 days. cells at 80% confluence were switched to DMEM/F12 containing 0.5% FBS for 48 h before being treated with 20 ng/ml of TNF or IL-1 for 4 or 24 h. RNA with or without 20 ng/ml of TNF was purified from the AM. the HC-HA complex was sliced into small pieces, frozen in liquid nitrogen, and ground to a fine powder by a bioPulverizer. agarose supernatants were pooled and continued to the third and fourth ultracentrifugation in a density of 1.42 g/ml by addition of cesium chloride. the pellet was briefly dried by air, stored at 80 °C, and designated AM second HC-HA and fourth HC-HA respectively. samples were incubated in 50 mm NaOH for 1 h at 25 °C or dissolved in 0.1 m sodium acetate buffer (pH 6.0) and incubated at 60 °C for 1 h with or without 20 units/ml of Streptomyces HAase. alkylation with iodoacetamide at 200 mm for 30 min at room temperature and addition of DTT. agarose gel electrophoresis of the AM HC-HA complex was separated on 0.5% (w/v) agarose gels, followed by staining with 0.005% (w/v) Stains-all dye in 50% (v/v) ethanol. the gels were stained overnight at 25 °C with light protection, and HA was visualized as bluish bands. cell cultures with an agarose overlay were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde with the agarose overlay for 15 min at room temperature. sections and cells were blocked with 0.2% (w/v) bovine serum albumin in PBS for 1 h. sections and cells were incubated overnight in a humidity chamber at 4 °C. HA was initially covalently cross-linked to Covalink-NH 96-well plates (2 g/well) at 4 °C for 16 h, and the unbound HA was removed by washing with PBS containing 2 m NaCl and 50 mm MgSO4 followed by PBS. the wells were then washed three times with PBST and then three times with 6 m GnHCl. incubation with 1-Step Ultra TMB-ELISA substrate solution and stop solution was read with 650 nm as a reference. cDNA was reverse-transcribed using a high-capacity reverse transcription kit and amplified by quantitative PCR. positive PTX3 staining was not only found in the apical surface of the epithelium, but also in the compact stroma. in contrast, PTX3 staining was markedly attenuated in the spongy stroma and the chorion and could not be unmasked by HAase digestion. positive HA immunostaining was specific to HA because it disappeared when the tissue section was predigested by HAase ouse, or Alexa Fluor 488-conjugated anti-rabbit IgG secondary antibodies (green) or probed with biotinylated HABP with or without HAase digestion. non-immune rat or mouse serum was used as a control. the HMW PTX3-containing species in the loading well was likely associated with the HC-HA complex because NaOH cleaves off the ester covalent linkage between HC and HA in the HC-HA complex. to further confirm this notion, we purified the HC-HA complex by two and four successive runs of ultracentrifugation from the AM soluble extract. a 90-kDa PTX3 dimer was noted in AM second and fourth HC-HA PTX3 smear was not an artifact because of reoligomerization. recombinant human PTX3 control, purified human II control, AM extract and the AM HC-HA complex were treated with or without 50 mm NaOH at 25 °C for 1 h or HAase at 37 °C for 1 h. the immunoblot was first probed with rat anti-PTX3 antibody (A) and then stripped and repro HC-HA complex displayed as an HMW species at the bottom of the loading well. HC1 was released from the HC-HA complex after HAase digestion. a free 80-kDa HC1 band was detected only in the second HC-HA complex. the presence of HA in the fourth HC-HA complex was verified by agarose gel electrophoresis. quantitative PCR showed that the expression of the PTX3 transcript was low in resting HSF but up-regulated by TNF and IL-1 4.1-fold and 2.0-fold respectively. the 45-kDa PTX3 protein band was detected in a small amount in lysates but undetectable in the medium of resting HSF by Western blot analysis. synthesis and secretion of PTX3 was further up-regulated by proinflammatory stimuli in resting AM cells but not HSF. total RNAs and proteins were extracted from HSF, AMEC, and AMSC cultures. expression of PTX3 mRNA was analyzed by real-time PCR with GAPDH as the endogenous control. agarose overlay reduced the HA level in the medium more than 50% in both FBS-free and FBS-containing conditions in all three cultures. agarose overlay reduced the HA level in the medium more than 50% in both FBS-free and FBS-containing conditions. agarose overlay reduces HA release into the medium. A, the HA concentration measured by ELISA assay was reduced. phase-contrast micrographs of HSF, AMSC, and AMEC cultured in both serum-free and FBS-containing conditions with or without agarose overlay. positive HC1 or HC2 staining was noted in AMSC and AMEC cultures. HC1 and HC2 staining was found in AMSC and AMEC even in the absence of FBS and TNF treatment. these results support the notion that extracellular HA-rich matrix was trapped by the agarose overlay in these cell cultures. kDa dimer, 45-kDa monomer, was readily detected in AMSC. results confirm that AMSC produced the HC-HA-PTX3 complex by constitutive production of PTX3. smear was generated by exogenous PTX3 in resting HSF without TNF. agarose-overlaid AMSC culture extracts with or without HAase digestion were subjected to Western blot analysis for PTX3 with or without NaOH treatment. agarose-overlaid AMSC culture extracts with or without HAase digestion were first immunoprecipitated with rabbit anti-human II polyclonal antibody (top panel), stripped, and reprobed with rat anti-human PTX3 monoclonal antibody (bottom panel) HAase digestion resulted in an increase of the 80-kDa HCs species and the HMW smear but not the 35-kDa species. the diffuse species at about 50 kDa corresponded to the heavy chains of rabbit IgG linked to Sepharose beads. after stripping, the same blot reprobed with the anti-PTX3 antibody showed a 45-kDa species, a 90-kDa species, and an H ELISAs confirmed no transfer of HCs from purified II to immobilized HA in the absence of TSG-6. without immobilized HA, no HC1 or HC2 was detected, even when II, TSG-6, and PTX3 were incubated in the wells. the amount of TSG-6 bound to immobilized HA greatly decreased when II was added together with TSG-6 to the immobilized HA compared with adding only TSG-6 to immobilized HA. PTX3 was detected dose-dependently when PTX3 was incubated along with II and TSG-6 with immobilized HA.
